column4: I asked before, but didn't get a real answer, so here goes again: How do I update apt-file? 'sudo apt-file update' isn't working
it's sudo apt-get update
apt-file is an application to search for files in the Debian repository
do a      sudo apt-get update  &&  sudo apt-file update
sudo apt-get update works fine
and do a    sudo apt-get upgrade
its updating now. Why doesnt sudo apt-get update not do a upgrade as well?
cos you're just updating the list of what's available so apt-get and synaptic can figure out if anything is new
why does sudo apt-get upgrade upgrade firefox?
until you become more experienced, it's best to just upgrade everything when you're told... later on you might need to hold back certain updates
do you use apt-file a lot?

okay so you don't need it. it's just to report on file versions of packages. don't worry - you don't need it. close that terminal window that it opened and then go into (from the top menu bar) System -> Administration -> synaptic package manager
okay then do a search for apt-file
so when you click on it, you should get a description below
does it sound like something you need? I don't think so ;)
anyway, right-click on the name "apt-file" in the top section and say "mark for removal"
you're starting out well on the ubuntu road :)
another way to easily update your packages is through the Add/Remove choiceunder "applications"   but you have to close the Synaptic package manager first
there's lots of games
Kdevelop is, it's been around for quite a while... ultimately it depends on what you're using
for instance monodevelop if you're a C# or VB/net person
cheers
